questions.Question_text: What is the most commonly used Python version?
options: A. Python 2.x
B. Python 3.x
C. Python 4.x
D. Python 5.x

questions.Question_text: What is the purpose of the 'print' function in Python?
options: A. To define a variable
B. To print output to the screen
C. To read input from the user
D. To store data in memory
questions.correct_answer: B. To print output to the screen

questions.Question_text: What is the difference between '==' and 'is' operators in Python?
options: A. Both are used for comparison
B. '==' checks type, while 'is' checks identity
C. '==' checks identity, while 'is' checks type
D. Both are used to assign values
questions.correct_answer: B. '==' checks type, while 'is' checks identity

questions.Question_text: What is the purpose of the 'try-except' block in Python?
options: A. To define a function
B. To handle errors and exceptions
C. To loop through data
D. To store data in memory
questions.correct_answer: B. To handle errors and exceptions

questions.Question_text: What is the difference between 'list' and 'tuple' in Python?
options: A. A list can be modified, while a tuple cannot
B. Both are immutable data structures
C. A list has more elements than a tuple
D. A tuple is a subset of a list
questions.correct_answer: A. A list can be modified, while a tuple cannot

questions.Question_text: What is the purpose of the 'lambda' function in Python?
options: A. To define a class
B. To create an anonymous function
C. To import modules
D. To assign values to variables
questions.correct_answer: B. To create an anonymous function

questions.Question_text: What is the difference between 'for' and 'while' loops in Python?
options: A. A for loop iterates over a sequence, while a while loop checks a condition
B. Both are used to repeat a block of code
C. A for loop is faster than a while loop
D. A while loop is more secure than a for loop
questions.correct_answer: A. A for loop iterates over a sequence, while a while loop checks a condition

questions.Question_text: What is the purpose of the 'import' statement in Python?
options: A. To define a function
B. To import modules and functions
C. To assign values to variables
D. To store data in memory
questions.correct_answer: B. To import modules and functions

questions.Question_text: What is the difference between 'list' and 'set' in Python?
options: A. A list can be modified, while a set cannot
B. Both are unordered data structures
C. A list has more elements than a set
D. A set is a subset of a list
questions.correct_answer: A. A list can be modified, while a set cannot

questions.Question_text: What is the purpose of the 'os' module in Python?
options: A. To define a class
B. To interact with the operating system
C. To create an anonymous function
D. To assign values to variables
questions.correct_answer: B. To interact with the operating system
